summary: This document is a July 2, 2020 court filing from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York requesting the unsealing of Indictment 20 Cr. 330 against Ghislaine Maxwell. It includes a letter to Judge Katharine H. Parker and the resulting unsealing order signed by the judge.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Named as the defendant in Indictment 20 Cr. 330, which is the subject of the unsealing request.

persons.name: Katharine H. Parker
persons.context: The judge to whom the request to unseal the indictment is addressed and who signed the unsealing order.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.context: The Acting U.S. Attorney who submitted the request to unseal the indictment and is listed as the prosecutor on the case.

persons.name: Alex Rossmiller
persons.context: Assistant U.S. Attorney listed on the unsealing order application.

connections.description: Strauss, as Acting U.S. Attorney, is the lead prosecutor for the government in the case against defendant Maxwell.
Judge Parker is the judicial officer presiding over the request to unseal the indictment against Maxwell.
Both are attorneys for the U.S. Attorney's Office working on the case to unseal the indictment.

events.title: Unsealing of Indictment 20 Cr. 330
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office files a request and obtains an order to unseal the indictment against Ghislaine Maxwell.

locations: Silvio J. Mollo Building, One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
United States District Court, Southern District of New York, 500 Pearl Street, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: The document formally initiates the public criminal case against Ghislaine Maxwell by unsealing Indictment 20 Cr. 330.

The indictment charges Ghislaine Maxwell under U.S. criminal codes including 18 U.S.C. §§ 2422, 2423(a), 1623, 371, & 2, which relate to crimes such as enticing minors to travel for illegal sexual activity, perjury, and conspiracy.
The legal action is being prosecuted by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, led by Acting U.S. Attorney Audrey Strauss.
The case is designated as a 'Wheel C' case, indicating it is part of a specific assignment system for judges in the district.
